meanings.definition: Of or relating to coccus bacteria.
meanings.sent1: The coccal bacteria were studied under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The doctor identified the coccal infection in the patient's blood sample.
meanings.sent3: The coccal bacteria threw a tiny party in the petri dish.
meanings.sent4: The coccal nature of the cells made them easily identifiable.
meanings.sent5: The coccal shape of the bacteria was like tiny round beads.

meanings.definition: Resembling a coccus in shape or arrangement.
meanings.sent1: The coccal structure of the plant cells was fascinating.
meanings.sent2: The coccal pattern on the butterfly's wings was beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The coccal arrangement of the candies in the jar was pleasing to the eye.
meanings.sent4: The coccal design of the building's windows added a unique touch.
meanings.sent5: The coccal shape of the clouds in the sky resembled fluffy cotton balls.
